page.title: 15THE RANGERS.
page.content: Stephen and I went to interview Alec Cargill,the chief Ranger,of Beecraigs country park. Beecraigs opened as a country park in 1972 when it was taken over from the water board,by Lothian Regional Council.The region now funds and controls the area.The water board looked after the Beecraigs reservoir which was built by German P.O.Ws. in World War 1. At Beecraigs one Ranger,one supervisor and a workman live in 1930 style houses.The other Rangers get there by car and the workmen get picked up by vans.The number of workmen varies at times to cover the work to be done. Alec was given the job as he was able to teach outdoor activities.
